729302f-b.text:
(1)
848 Richmond Avenue, adjoining the N.E. corner of Renfrew Place, showing the G. Houseman House (Beers's 1874 map). Mr. P. L. Sperr states that this is the house in which Polly Bodine, who was accused in a famous murder trial, lived.
By Wm. T. Davis through P. L. Sperr
NO REPRODUCTIONS  October 1924
(2)
A view westward
ctober 1924
P. L. Sperr
(3)
An additional view, at a later date.
March 24, 1928
P. L. Sperr

729302f-c.folder: Richmond Avenue & Renfrew Place, Staten Island, NY

729304f-b.text:
(1)
876 Richmond Avenue, at the N. W. corner of Renfrew Place, showing the Renfrew House (Beers's 1874 map). Mr. P. L. Sperr states that it is the house of Polly Bodine fame, in which the murder with which her name was connected was committed.
About 1900
By Eugene G. Putnam
From Staten Island Museum Collection through P. L. Sperr
(2) A view of the house, years later.
January 4, 1924
By Villiam T. Davis through P. L. Sperr
(3)
A side view of the house. This view shows some slight architectural changes from that of view 1.
October,1924
By William T. Davis through P. L. Sperr
729304f-b.folder: Richmond Avenue & Renfrew Place, Staten Island, NY
